intro: Diplotaxis ibicensis, commonly known as the Canary Island cress, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many species of mustard and cress. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with slender stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, round pods that contain several seeds. This species is adapted to the arid and rocky conditions of its native habitat.
